content:
• Wednesday, November 7, 2012
  • PAAS

    Pan American Silver (NASDAQ:PAAS): Q3 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $251M misses by...

    Pan American Silver (NASDAQ:PAAS): Q3 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $251M misses by $18M. (PR) Shares -3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 PM

    Teekay Tankers Ltd. (NYSE:TNK) declares $0.02/share quarterly dividend, -81.8% decrease from...

    Teekay Tankers Ltd. (NYSE:TNK) declares $0.02/share quarterly dividend, -81.8% decrease from prior dividend of $0.11. For shareholders of record Nov. 19. Payable Nov. 26. Ex-div Nov. 15. Shares -11.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM
  • LORL

    Loral Space & Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ:LORL) declares special distribution of...

    Loral Space & Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ:LORL) declares special distribution of $29.0/share. For shareholders of record Nov. 19. Payable Dec. 4. Ex-div Nov. 15. Shares +10.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM | 1 Comment

    Flotek Industries (NYSE:FTK): Q3 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $78.6M (+4.7% Y/Y)...

    Flotek Industries (NYSE:FTK): Q3 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $78.6M (+4.7% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -6.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM

    Global Cash Access Holdings (GCA): Q3 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $149.8M (+9.4%...

    Global Cash Access Holdings (GCA): Q3 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $149.8M (+9.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)

    Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX): Q3 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $190.4M (+17.5%...

    Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX): Q3 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $190.4M (+17.5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +3.5% AH. (PR)

    Primo Water (NASDAQ:PRMW): Q3 EPS of -$0.04 in-line. Revenue of $26.2M (+8.7% Y/Y) in-line....

    Primo Water (NASDAQ:PRMW): Q3 EPS of -$0.04 in-line. Revenue of $26.2M (+8.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +13.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • BLMN

    Bloomin' Brands (NASDAQ:BLMN): Q3 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $952.9M (+2.7% Y/Y)...

    Bloomin' Brands (NASDAQ:BLMN): Q3 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $952.9M (+2.7% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +7.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) has resumed trading, and is down 29.1% AH after reporting a big...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) has resumed trading, and is down 29.1% AH after reporting a big Q3 miss it blamed on industry demand - in particular, the failure of Samsung to ramp green OLED material production, as PANL was expecting. The company's earnings call starts at 5PM ET (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • SNTS

    Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS): Q3 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $54.7M (+104% Y/Y) beats by...

    Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS): Q3 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $54.7M (+104% Y/Y) beats by $2.1M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • SLXP

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SLXP): Q3 EPS of $0.95 beats by $0.25. Revenue of $185.1M (+26.6%...

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SLXP): Q3 EPS of $0.95 beats by $0.25. Revenue of $185.1M (+26.6% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Shares +8.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL): Q3 EPS of -$0.12 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $12.5M (-43% Y/Y)...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL): Q3 EPS of -$0.12 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $12.5M (-43% Y/Y) misses by $6.4M. Expects 2012 revenue of $80M-$92M, below a consensus of $99.8M. Company blames "a temporary slowdown in industry growth." Shares halted. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • ITMN

    InterMune (NASDAQ:ITMN): Q3 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.88. Revenue of $14.9M beats by $8.6M....

    InterMune (NASDAQ:ITMN): Q3 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.88. Revenue of $14.9M beats by $8.6M. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • MAKO

    More on MAKO Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q3 beats consensus on both EPS and revenue, but the company...

    More on MAKO Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q3 beats consensus on both EPS and revenue, but the company lowers its guidance for MAKOplasty procedures in Q4, based on the total procedures performed in the first three quarters of FY12 and the unknown net effect of Hurricane Sandy. It now expects to perform between 10,200 to 10,600 procedures, down from prior guidance of 11K to 12K. FY12 annual guidance of 42 - 48 expected RIO system sales remains unchanged. Shares -1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • MNST

    More on Monster Beverage's (NASDAQ:MNST) Q3: Higher expenses outpaced sales growth as the...

    More on Monster Beverage's (NASDAQ:MNST) Q3: Higher expenses outpaced sales growth as the company's gross profit as a percentage of sales dropped 90 bps to 51.7%. Plans for new international launches later this year and in 2013 are still on track. In a tipoff on Q4 numbers, CEO Rodney Sacks says October sales were up 28% Y/Y. No details on a pending FDA probe and lawsuit are disclosed. Shares -10.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 10 Comments
  • AMZN

    More on Whole Foods Market's (WFM) FQ4: The company shoots par with analyst estimates for the...

    More on Whole Foods Market's (WFM) FQ4: The company shoots par with analyst estimates for the quarter as comparable-store sales rose 8.5%. Seven new stores were added during the period. Sees sales growth of 12% to 14% in FY13 and EPS falling in a range of $2.83-$2.87. A one-time charge due to the impact of Hurricane Sandy is slated for FQ1. Shares -4.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 4 Comments
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST): Q3 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $632.3M (+15.4% Y/Y)...

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST): Q3 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $632.3M (+15.4% Y/Y) beats by $50M. Shares -13.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • MAKO

    Mako Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q3 EPS loss of -$0.15 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $29M (+41% Y/Y)...

    Mako Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q3 EPS loss of -$0.15 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $29M (+41% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • ATVI

    Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI): Q3 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $751M (+19.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI): Q3 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $751M (+19.8% Y/Y) beats by $42M. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM): FQ4 EPS of $0.89 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $4.87B (+18% Y/Y) beats by...

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM): FQ4 EPS of $0.89 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $4.87B (+18% Y/Y) beats by $200M. Expects FQ1 revenue of $5.6B-$6.1B and EPS of $1.08-$1.16, above a consensus of $5.29B and $1.00. Expects FY13 revenue of $23B-$24B and EPS of $4.12-$4.32, largely above a consensus of $21.7B and $4.13. Shares +7.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • CALX

    Though many telecom equipment names with strong U.S. exposure rallied in response to AT&T's...

    Though many telecom equipment names with strong U.S. exposure rallied in response to AT&T's capex announcement, Calix (CALX -9.7%) fell hard today. A likely reason: Calix depends heavily on sales to tier-2 carriers who will be in the crosshairs of AT&T's Project Velocity, which seeks to both expand the company's wireline broadband reach and make its 4G network a broadband option in many rural areas.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • NLY

    Annaly (NLY -2.7%) is downgraded to Equal Weight at Barclays, the analysts saying net interest...

    Annaly (NLY -2.7%) is downgraded to Equal Weight at Barclays, the analysts saying net interest margin of 124 bps translates into a ROE of 8.5% going forward - not enough to cover the estimated cost of equity (10%). The frightening thing is spreads could compress further (double digits?), making even stock buybacks ineffectual at propping the share price.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 5 Comments
  • CALI

    China Auto Logistics (OTC:CALI +70%) soars after the Nasdaq Stock Market notified it that it has...

    China Auto Logistics (OTC:CALI +70%) soars after the Nasdaq Stock Market notified it that it has regained compliance with it's minimum bid price continued listing requirement, as a result of its closing bid price at or above the minimum requirement of $1 per share for at least 10 consecutive trading days.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • GTE

    Gran Tierra Energy (GTE +3.4%) pushes higher after Q3 results showed record levels of production...

    Gran Tierra Energy (GTE +3.4%) pushes higher after Q3 results showed record levels of production of more than 19K boe/day, and the addition of "substantial" potential reserves at the Moqueta field in Colombia. Earnings fell slightly, to $0.16/share vs. $0.17 in the same period a year ago, while revenue and cash flow were stronger.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • BA

    In an effort to reduce costs, Boeing (BA -2%) announces a major restructuring of its defense...

    In an effort to reduce costs, Boeing (BA -2%) announces a major restructuring of its defense division. The nation's second-largest defense contractor plans to cut 30% of its management positions from 2010 levels, close facilities in California and consolidate several business units. The cuts are aimed at saving the company an additional $1.6B through 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 8 Comments
  • HDY

    Shares of Hyperdynamics (HDY +19%) are up today after its Board of Directors approved an...

    Shares of Hyperdynamics (HDY +19%) are up today after its Board of Directors approved an amendment to lengthen the period during which stock options may be exercised. The period has now been extended, following the date that a participant leaves the company, from one year to eighteen months, as long as the period does not extend past the termination date specified in the option agreement.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (ILMN +2.7%) spikes higher on what appears to be renewed takeover rumors. There is...

    Illumina (ILMN +2.7%) spikes higher on what appears to be renewed takeover rumors. There is speculation however, that the move might related to the company's presentation today at the ASHG Conference being held in San Francisco, but the company is only sponsoring a workshop that isn't due to begin for another hour.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -8.6%) is among the day's big tech losers ahead of this afternoon's Q3...

    Universal Display (PANL -8.6%) is among the day's big tech losers ahead of this afternoon's Q3 report. Samsung's strong Q3 smartphone sales bode well for PANL, which has been dogged by worries Samsung and others will strike deals with additional OLED materials suppliers. DisplaySearch recent issued a cautious outlook for near-term OLED TV adoption, but those concerns appear priced in.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • MRO

    Marathon Oil (MRO -3.8%) is upgraded to Buy with a $40 target price (up from $35) at Global...

    Marathon Oil (MRO -3.8%) is upgraded to Buy with a $40 target price (up from $35) at Global Hunter after soundly beating Q3 production guidance. Eagle Ford is running at 60K boe/day, with 85K targeted for 2013; Bakken is running at 30K boe/day, with 33K planned for next year. Annual capex for 2012-13 is still seen at $5B-$5.5B, welcome given the increase in production guidance, the firm writes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • THQIQ

    THQ (THQI -28%) continues to crater after withdrawing guidance, announcing game delays and a...

    THQ (THQI -28%) continues to crater after withdrawing guidance, announcing game delays and a need for fresh capital, and generally putting its survival in doubt in the eyes of many. "The big question is, can it make it to next year?," MKM's Eric Handler asked recently. He noted THQ's cash balance has dropped by 50% since the beginning of FY13, and that it has already tapped $21M from its $50M credit line.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 4 Comments
  • RAX

    Richly-valued Rackspace (RAX -5.4%) is selling off after delivering a decent (but not...

    Richly-valued Rackspace (RAX -5.4%) is selling off after delivering a decent (but not spectacular) Q3 report (I, II) - shares are still up strongly from July levels. Rackspace noted on its earnings call it's seeing healthy early interest in its OpenStack cloud infrastructure solutions, whose scalability help Rackspace better compete with Amazon Web Services (AWS), and that it has led to "conversations with large enterprise customers that we just weren't having a year ago." Rackspace is hoping its service quality and user control will help counter Amazon's pricing edge.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • CNC

    Medicare and Medicaid insurers are joining the Obamacare re-election party as well, as the...

    Medicare and Medicaid insurers are joining the Obamacare re-election party as well, as the legislation ensures dollars will continue flowing to their companies. Centene (CNC +10%), WellCare (WCG +2.7%) and Molina Healthcare (MOH +2.9) all gain ground.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    "We believe [BlackBerry 10] is likely to be DOA," asserts Pac Crest's James Faucette, whose...

    "We believe [BlackBerry 10] is likely to be DOA," asserts Pac Crest's James Faucette, whose bearish remarks are contributing to today's selloff in Research In Motion (RIMM -7.5%). BB10's unfamiliar UI and dearth of apps will hurt its appeal, thinks Faucette, who also issued a very bearish report on RIM in September.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 17 Comments
  • AMT

    U.S. cell tower owners American Tower (AMT +2.4%), SBA (SBAC +1.6%), and Crown Castle (CCI...

    U.S. cell tower owners American Tower (AMT +2.4%), SBA (SBAC +1.6%), and Crown Castle (CCI +0.8%) are also getting a lift from AT&T's (T -2.3%) capex plans, which include a push to offer 4G LTE services as a broadband option for rural areas. Wells Fargo expects AMT to benefit from AT&T's plan to adds 10K new cell sites and 40K small cells, while Citi views Ciena (CIEN +8%), Juniper (JNPR +1.8%), Cisco (CSCO -0.9%), and Adtran (ADTN +4.2%) as beneficiaries of Ma Bell's wireline investments.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • HCA

    Shares of major hospital companies jump today as fears are allayed over a Mitt Romney...

    Shares of major hospital companies jump today as fears are allayed over a Mitt Romney administration that would undo Obamacare. The repeal of Obamacare would have meant that hospitals would have to put a large share of "bad debt" back on their books in order to pay for indigent patients' emergency care. HCA Holdings (HCA +9.5%), Tenet Healthcare (THC +10%), Health Management Associates (HMA +8.2%) and Community Health Systems (CYH +7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • OWW

    Orbitz (OWW -11.3%) continues to be the sick man of online travel. Though Q3 EPS beat estimates,...

    Orbitz (OWW -11.3%) continues to be the sick man of online travel. Though Q3 EPS beat estimates, revenue fell short, and guidance for Q4 revenue of $183M-$189M is below a $191.1M consensus. Also, Q4 adjusted EBITDA guidance of $32M-$37M (down from Q3's $39.8M) suggests EPS could miss a consensus of $0.12. Q3 gross bookings fell 7% Y/Y, a big contrast to Priceline's 25% increase. Along with the report, Orbitz announced it has hired Sara Lee exec Mitch Marcus to be its new CFO - the company's last permanent CFO resigned in May. (PR - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • ALL

    Allstate's (ALL -1.6%)weakness following Hurricane Sandy has created a buying opportunity, says...

    Allstate's (ALL -1.6%)weakness following Hurricane Sandy has created a buying opportunity, says Argus. The stock's dropped nearly 10% since the storm, and Argus estimates that insurers may only have to pay out 40%-50% of the losses caused by the storm. The stock's multiples are below current levels, and the firm projects it's EPS should grow at an 8% rate over the long-term.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • HFC

    HollyFrontier (HFC +0.9%) is one of few energy issues on the rise today, after Q3 earnings...

    HollyFrontier (HFC +0.9%) is one of few energy issues on the rise today, after Q3 earnings jumped 15% as wide differences between crude prices boosted refining margins 8.7% Y/Y. HFC says the structural crude advantages currently driving strong operating margins will continue to positively impact operating income, allowing it to continue to pay regular and special dividends.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -11.5%) is seeing another down day in response to the Google verdict (I, II) -...

    Vringo (VRNG -11.5%) is seeing another down day in response to the Google verdict (I, II) - shares are now down 25% since yesterday's trading halt ended. Maxim joins others in estimating the jury's recommended royalty rate could lead to $500M in payments to Vringo until April 2016, but also cautions a Google appeal could take 12-15 months to play out, and that the company might try to create a workaround.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 7 Comments
  • ALLT

    Allot (ALLT +5.7%) is rallying in response to rival Procera's (PKT +14.7%) strong Q3 results (I,...

    Allot (ALLT +5.7%) is rallying in response to rival Procera's (PKT +14.7%) strong Q3 results (I, II). Raymond James' positive commentary on Procera has implications for Allot as well: the firm thinks the deep packet inspection hardware market will show a 30% CAGR from 2011-2016, and believes Procera's surging mobile sales (45% of revenue in Q3 vs. 14% in Q2) indicate demand from the segment could be near an "inflection point." (PKT transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • AUXL

    Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL -8%) drops after terminating its collaboration agreement with...

    Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL -8%) drops after terminating its collaboration agreement with Pfizer (PFE -1%) to develop the drug Xiapex, a treatment for Dupuytren's disease, in the European Union and certain other European and Eurasian countries. The agreement will terminate no later than April 24, 2013, after which rights to commercialize Xiapex will revert to AUXL.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • CDE

    Coeur d’Alene Mines (CDE +7.1%) bounces back from yesterday's shellacking after reporting...

    Coeur d’Alene Mines (CDE +7.1%) bounces back from yesterday's shellacking after reporting a disappointing Q3 marked by big drops in production. BMO Capital upgrades shares to Outperform from Market Perform based on valuation and expectations that issues at CDE's Palmarejo silver and gold mine in Mexico are temporary.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • CCRN

    Cross Country Healthcare (CCRN -7.1%) drops after reporting a $0.02 Q3 net loss due to...

    Cross Country Healthcare (CCRN -7.1%) drops after reporting a $0.02 Q3 net loss due to impairment charges, missing Street expectations for a gain of $0.02. Revenue also slipped 1.6% to $129M, barely beating expectations. The company also lowered its Q4 sales guidance, now expecting sales between $126M -$129M, below Street estimates for $130M. EPS estimates are also trimmed to a loss of $(0.01) - $(0.03), versus expectations of a $0.04 gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • AMRS

    Amyris (AMRS +27%) soars after blowing out Q3 estimates late yesterday. Revenue actually fell...

    Amyris (AMRS +27%) soars after blowing out Q3 estimates late yesterday. Revenue actually fell 47% Y/Y - largely due to the company's transition out of the ethanol business - but the company still managed to easily beat expectations by $9.7M. Top-line numbers benefited from higher sales of renewable products after it revised its collaboration agreement with Total (TOT -3.7%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • ALJ

    Alon USA Energy (ALJ -7.2%) is shutting its California refining system for up to a year because...

    Alon USA Energy (ALJ -7.2%) is shutting its California refining system for up to a year because of the weak asphalt market and high West Coast crude oil costs. ALJ could restart the system in Q4 2013 if plans to build a facility to receive cheaper Midcontinent crude by rail goes forward as planned. ALJ's California system involves three facilities operating as a single 94K bbl/day system.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • YPF

    Net profit at YPF (YPF -2.2%) fell 51% Y/Y during Q3 due to increased operating costs and poorer...

    Net profit at YPF (YPF -2.2%) fell 51% Y/Y during Q3 due to increased operating costs and poorer performance by companies in which YPF has a stake, as well as a deferred tax payment. Argentina sits on huge resources of shale natural gas and oil, but large amounts of capital would be needed to bring them into production; YPF rules out any foray into global credit markets "anytime in the short term."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • CNTF

    China Techfaith (CNTF +12.3%) takes off after SA's Biotech Breakthroughs argues shares are a...

    China Techfaith (CNTF +12.3%) takes off after SA's Biotech Breakthroughs argues shares are a bargain in light of the company's $252M net cash balance (over 4x its market cap) and patent portfolio (currently being used in a suit against Samsung). He also notes CEO Defu Dong owns 1/3 of the phone vendor following recent purchases, and raises the possibility Dong could follow the lead of CEOs of other Chinese tech firms with low valuations in making a going-private offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • CECO

    The selloff in for-profit education stocks is linked to the higher regulation the sector may see...

    The selloff in for-profit education stocks is linked to the higher regulation the sector may see under an Obama administration, according to CNBC's Karina Frayter. After the Department of Education adopted a "gainful employment" rule and President Obama signed an executive order to increase transparency, traders may be wondering what's next for the sector in the form of oversight.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • RBCN

    Rubicon (RBCN -20.8%) has made multi-year lows after using its Q3 report to guide for Q4 revenue...

    Rubicon (RBCN -20.8%) has made multi-year lows after using its Q3 report to guide for Q4 revenue to be flat Q/Q (well below a consensus for a 30% increase), and for EPS to come in at -$0.02 to -$0.05 (below a $0.04 consensus). Rubicon notes prices for 2"-4" LED wafers continues to fall, and that weak industry demand has slowed the adoption of costlier 6" wafers, which are also seeing price pressure. LED equipment suppliers are underperforming. AIXG -3.2%. VECO -2.4%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • HUM

    Humana (HUM -8.1%) slides on a couple of  post-election downgrades. Goldman Sachs cut the...

    Humana (HUM -8.1%) slides on a couple of  post-election downgrades. Goldman Sachs cut the managed care provider to Sell, saying it holds a precariously high exposure to Medicare Advantage, which heightens the stocks regulatory risk and uncertainty following the President's victory. The firm also trimmed its price target to $62 a share from $77. Separately, BofA Merrill Lynch also downgraded the shares to Neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • REFR

    Research Frontiers (REFR -3.3%) slips after filing a secondary offering to sell up to 3M shares...

    Research Frontiers (REFR -3.3%) slips after filing a secondary offering to sell up to 3M shares of common stock. The company also filed to sell 1.25M shares of common stock offered by the selling stockholders, 250,000 warrants to purchase common stock offered by the selling stockholders, 250,000 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the warrants offered by the selling stockholders. The company will not receive any proceeds from the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • T

    In addition to hiking its dividend, AT&T (T -2.9%) says it plans to spend $22B on capex each...

    In addition to hiking its dividend, AT&T (T -2.9%) says it plans to spend $22B on capex each of the next 3 years, up from 2011's $19B-$20B. $8B will be spent on building AT&T's 4G LTE network, which trails Verizon (VZ -1.5%) in terms of coverage, and $6B on expanding its wireline broadband network. AT&T is also guiding for mid-single-digit annual EPS growth over this time. Capex-starved telecom equipment/component names are rallying. CIEN +11.2%. ADTN +8.1%. APKT +5.8%. JNPR +2.1%. JDSU +6.8%. ALU +2.5%. (investor day: webcast, slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • BDX

    More on Becton Dickinson (BDX -3.8%) FQ4: net profit -3.6% to $289M, with earnings hurt by weak...

    More on Becton Dickinson (BDX -3.8%) FQ4: net profit -3.6% to $289M, with earnings hurt by weak revenue at its biosciences and medical ops, pension settlement charges, and forex fluctuations. U.S. sales +1.2%, international -2.6%, but +7.1% excluding currency impact. Gross margin falls to 50.9% from 51.2%. Expects FY revenue growth of 2%-3% and EPS from continuing ops of $5.58-$5.64 vs consensus of +3% and $5.80.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • APOL

    It's a bloodbath for education stocks in early post-election trading. Called "President stocks"...

    It's a bloodbath for education stocks in early post-election trading. Called "President stocks" by some analysts due to the support the Obama administration has offered for federal backing of student loans, today the sector is in far from a celebratory mood. Was it something President Obama said last night?
